title: Where did the band Blue Oyster Cult get their name from? - Quora

response.answer_text: Blue Öyster Cult…  Are an American hard Rock Band… They were formed in Long Island, New York in 1967… Famous for songs like “The Reaper", "Godzilla", "Shooting Shark", and "Burnin' for You" selling over 24 million records worldwide, and 7 million records in the United States alone. Their music videos, especially "Burnin' for You", Were also highly popular.  blue Oyster cult - Bing images Originally named… ”Soft White Underbelly”… From a Winston Churchill speech. The group consisted of guitarist Buck Dharma, drummer Albert Bouchard, keyboardist Allen Lanier, singer Les Braunstein and bassist Andrew Winters. Eric Bloom eventually replaced Braunstein to became lead singer.  After a few more temporary band name… Including the Santos Sisters, the band settled on Blue Öyster Cult in 1971.The name came from a 1960s poem written by manager Sandy Pearlman. In which, the "Blue Oyster Cult" was a group of aliens who had assembled to secretly guide Earth's history. Their debut album “Blue Oyster Cult” was released in January 1972,  blue Oyster cult - Bing images    blue Oyster cult - Bing images For more information on “The Blue Oyster Cult” Please follow the link below… Blue Öyster Cult - Wikipedia

The name "Blue Öyster Cult" came from a 1960s poem written by manager Sandy Pearlman. It was part of his "Imaginos" poetry, later used more extensively on their album Imaginos (1988). Pearlman had also come up with the band's earlier name, "Soft White Underbelly", from a phrase used by Winston Churchill in describing Italy during World War II. In Pearlman's poetry, the "Blue Oyster Cult" was a group of aliens who had assembled to secretly guide Earth's history. From Wikipedia
